meanings.definition: The point in time when something is at its lowest level or weakest state.
meanings.sent1: At the ebbet of the storm, the wind calmed down.
meanings.sent2: The ebbet of his energy was evident after a long day at work.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her patience was at its ebbet when waiting in line.
meanings.sent4: The ebbet of the river revealed hidden treasures in the mud.
meanings.sent5: The ebbet of the market signaled the end of the trading day.

meanings.definition: To gradually decrease or diminish in intensity or strength.
meanings.sent1: His enthusiasm began to ebbet as the project dragged on.
meanings.sent2: The sunlight started to ebbet as evening approached.
meanings.sent3: The music ebbeted softly into the night, lulling everyone to sleep.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence ebbeted like a tide going out.
meanings.sent5: The noise of the crowd ebbeted, allowing her to focus on her thoughts.
